posts.raw_content:
Forgiveness and harsh punishments are not mutually exclusive. I know what Charlie said in the past, and you're welcome to forgive the shooter if you want, but he needs to get the death penalty. 

EDIT:

Some of you are questioning why I'd mention this.  In the past, Charlie said that "forgiveness is the best way to annoy your enemies" and similar things about mercy. At today's presser, "forgiveness" was a bell rung several times. 

After watching the presser at a real-world pro-Trump place, I heard discussion about Christian values favoring forgiveness and contemplations about what Charlie would say, and so on. There were also questions about whether Erika, his wife, will want (or be pressed) into forgiveness angles to "cool the temperature."

EDIT2: 

Trump is fortunately pushing for the death penalty.

https://x.com/bennyjohnson/status/1966477600143880289
